definition: A process which has as expected output a draft of an agreement.
A planned process in which the required parties sign an agreement proposal to signify their agreement with the proposed terms. The resulting document is an agreement document.

term: Application for data to data custodian
definition: A process by which a project research group seeks to obtain permission to have access to data items from a data custodian.
A project component activity that permits DASH to restart DC-specific DC activities and communicate this fact to the DC, the latter taking appropriate actions in response.
A process by which a DASH User acquires information about metadata, data metrics and data provenance elements of data items, as well as selection functions.
A process that takes the results of site Eligibility Reviews and, based on discussions with the research group, comes to a final decision on whether a project should proceed.
A process that has as a result a final decision regarding a set of data custodian feasibility reviews.

A DASH coordination process in which a project workflow is directed to provide one of: DASH guidance to a PRG; allow for the completion of a form associated with an HDC application process; termination of a project, including a project debrief.
A process by which a DASH User acquires information about services offered by a data custodian.
A project component activity that permits DASH to restart DC-specific TEA activities and communicate this fact to the DC, the latter taking appropriate actions in response.
A process by which a DASH User acquires information about eligibility requirements from a data custodian.
A process having as participants DASH members and DASH users. It includes guided exploration and identification of services desired from project workflow contributors.
A process which has as expected output a draft of a legal agreement  between a PRG and a DC (Glossary: Agreement drafting).

term: DC Agreement resource and cost review
definition: A resource and cost review which finalises costs and resource use for inclusion within a legal agreement between a PRG and a DC.
An agreement signature where the required parties are a data custodian and a project research group.
A review performed by a DASH to confirm that information required by an HDC application process is complete and available for submission to the HDC
A process to produce and validate a DC specfiic project dataset.

A review performed by a data custodian team in collaboration with a project research group which assesses whether the [cohort] data item requirements defined by a project protocol can be fullfilled by a data custodian.

A review performed by a data custodian team in collaboration with a project research group which assesses whether the [extract] data item requirements defined by a project protocol can be fullfilled by a data custodian.
A review performed by a data controller team which evaluates project protocol alignment with its policies and, if applicable, delegated data control agreements
A data selection by which a project cohort identifier list is generated.
A data processing generating a new data asset using a transformation function which has as input a set of datasets.

term: Data custodian privacy enhancing technique processing
definition: A sub-process of data assembly by which privacy enhancing technique functions are applied by a data custodian technical team to the dataset which is the output of the data preparation.

An eligibility review performed by a data custodian team which uses custodian-defined governance criteria to establish the right of the project research group to have a project protocol evaluated by the DCG team.
A review performed by a data custodian team which determines resources and cost required to provide access to data items, and other requested services options (if applicable).
A process by which a D-SPD is copied to another organisation's infrastructure or a TEA.
A process by which a dataset is generated by applying a function to a set of datasets.
A data processing generating a new data asset using a selection function which has as input a set of datasets.
A data processing generating a new data asset using a transformation function which has as input a set of datasets.
A application element review which ensures that appropriate documentation arising from an ethics committee assessment was submitted as part of an application process.
An application element review which ensures that an appropriate documentation from some funding source was submitted as part of an application process.
A process by which project research group members include a project analysis data output into an artefact for release to the wider interested community.
A review performed by a DC confirming the completion and usability of a non-disclosure agreement.

A process by which one or more project research group members demonstrate knowledge of the requirements that a data custodian places on the use and handling of D-SPD provided to ensure continued good governance of that D-SPD and associated project analysis and publication.
A review by a DC confirming that PET processing has been performed during a data assembly.
A review with the goal of ensuring that privacy and patient-practitioner confidentiality are not compromised during processes directed by the project protocol.
A DASH instruction to a DC, sent by an agreed method, requesting a DC-related project component activity be completed.

term: Process DASH project research group instruction
definition: A DASH instruction to a PRG, sent by an agreed method, requesting a PRG-related project component activity be completed.

term: Process DASH trusted environment for analysis instruction
definition: A DASH instruction to a DC, sent by an agreed method, requesting a TEA-related project component activity be completed.
A process enabling a PRG to analyse one or more D-SPD as input.
A process by which a project cohort preparation takes place and the size of a project cohort identifier list is evaluated in the context of a project protocol.
A review conducted by a data controller team to evaluate whether a project analysis data output can be transferred to a different data custodian as requested by a PRG.
A data processing by which a D-SPD is transformed by project analysts.
A process performed by a DASH following the decision and action to end a project - in conjunction with a PRG and participating DCs - to learn lessons from that project.

A process that takes the results of site Feasibility Reviews and, based on discussions with the project research group, comes to a final decision on whether a project should proceed to a formal data access request and governance review.
A process by which project research group members include a project analysis data output into an artefact for release to the wider interested community.
A review conducted by a organisation team to evaluate whether a project publication candidate can be made available outside the project research group.

A project research group activity by which one or more project research group members demonstrate knowledge of the requirements that a data custodian places on the use and handling of D-SPD provided to ensure continued good governance of that D-SPD and associated project analysis and publication.
A process in which a set of artefacts are used by an organisation team to establish whether a condition required by a process is met.
An application element review which ensures that appropriate documentation arising from a Scientific Peer review assessment was submitted as part of an application process.
A resource and cost valuation by a DASH based on aggregate data associated with similar projects performed in the past by that DASH.
A planned process by which a plan entity sends a specific signal to a specified channel.
A process which has as expected output a draft of a legal agreement  between a PRG and a TEA provider.

term: TEA Agreement resource and cost review
definition: A resource and cost review which finalises costs and resource use for inclusion within a legal agreement between a PRG and a TEA provider.
An agreement signature where the required parties are those data custodians contributing to the TEA and a project research group.

An eligibility review performed by a TEA provider which uses custodian-defined governance criteria to establish the right of the project research group to have a project protocol evaluated by that TEA provider.

term: TEA estimated resource and cost review
definition: A resource and cost review which estimates the costs and resources expected to be used by a TEA provider in the fulfilment of a project protocol.
A requested services review performed by a TEA provider.
A planned process by which a plan entity waits until a specific signal is available through a specified channel; then ends.
